Title: 25 Best Work from Home Jobs for 2023
Text: [In this article, we will look at the 25 best work-from-home jobs for 2023. We will also discuss the key companies offering incredible opportunities to work from the comfort of one’s home while also exploring the future of remote work in 2023. If you want to skip our detailed analysis, head straight to 5 Best Work-From-Home Jobs for 2023.The COVID-19 pandemic has brought about a lasting change in the way people work, with remote work becoming increasingly popular and preferred. Research shows that remote work has had a positive impact on people's well-being, with higher job satisfaction and mental health reported among those working from home. Moreover, a significant majority of individuals who switched to remote work during the pandemic often express their willingness to continue working remotely even as the pandemic has ended.However, according to the Labor Department, recent data suggests a decline in remote work, with 72.5% of businesses reporting that their employees rarely or never teleworked in 2022. This is up from 60.1 percent in 2021 and close to pre-pandemic levels of 76.7%. However, other surveys, including those conducted by Stanford University and the Census Bureau, indicate that remote work remains prevalent, accounting for over a quarter of paid full-time workdays in the U.S.How to work from home in 2023?We see that the demand for remote and work-from-home jobs has significantly increased in 2023, with a 20% rise in remote job postings compared to the previous year. According to FlexJobs, companies recognize the benefits of remote workers, including improved retention rates, diverse talent pools, increased productivity, and cost-efficiency. A survey revealed that 65% of people want to work remotely full-time, with 63% willing to switch jobs if remote work isn't an option. To work from home in 2023, you can consider targeting the following companies for your next job:GitLab Inc (NASDAQ:GTLB) is known for its successful implementation of remote work opportunities. As an all-remote company, it has built a strong reputation for adopting and supporting remote work culture. Professionals working at GitLab Inc (NASDAQ:GTLB) come from diverse fields such as software engineering, product management, design, marketing, and sales.Story continuesGitLab Inc (NASDAQ:GTLB)'s remote work policies have attracted talent globally, which has enabled them to work from anywhere and collaborate effectively. The company's emphasis on remote work has allowed it to tap into a global talent pool and cultivate a culture of inclusivity, flexibility, and productivity. According to Glassdoor, Gitlab Inc (NASDAQ:GTLB) is currently hiring for remote positions like Senior Security Engineer, Senior Financial Analyst, and Staff Executive Business Administrator with salaries as high as $240,000Alternatively, Cisco Systems Inc (NASDAQ:CSCO) is a multinational technology company that has been at the forefront of enabling remote work through its innovative solutions and services. With its extensive portfolio of collaboration tools, including Webex and Cisco Jabber, Cisco empowers organizations and individuals to work remotely and collaborate seamlessly.Cisco System Inc (NASDAQ:CSCO) has not only provided the technology infrastructure for remote work but has also embraced remote work as a core part of its own company culture. Many professionals at Cisco, including engineers, developers, sales representatives, and support staff, work remotely, leveraging Cisco System Inc (NASDAQ:CSCO)'s own collaboration solutions.Amazon.com Inc (NASDAQ:AMZN) also embraces remote work as a vital component of its business model that enables a diverse workforce comprising talented individuals from around the globe. With operations spanning multiple countries and time zones, remote work plays a crucial role in Amazon.com Inc (NASDAQ:AMZN)'s growth.It recognizes that preferences for work arrangements vary and thus, it offers hybrid roles that provide flexibility in terms of work locations and online availability. Amazon.com Inc (NASDAQ:AMZN) also offers fully remote positions that may promote a better work-life balance, facilitate global collaboration, and allow employees to deliver their best work.What is the future of remote work in 2023?It's evident that remote work is highly appreciated by the majority of Millennials, who prioritize a comfortable work environment, flexible work schedules, and jobs with a healthy work-life balance. In fact, many Millennials are now unwilling to consider job opportunities that don't offer at least some level of remote work. Given that Millennials comprise the largest segment of the workforce, it's clear that remote work is here to stay. As we move forward into 2023 and beyond, companies must be prepared to adapt and cater to the evolving expectations and demands of Millennials, ensuring that remote work opportunities align with their needs.25 Best Work from Home Jobs for 2023Photo by Glenn Taubenfeld on UnsplashMethodologyWe conducted a comprehensive analysis of the top work-from-home jobs for 2023, drawing information from reputable sources such as Upwork Inc (NASDAQ:UPWK), Fiverr International Ltd (NYSE:FVRR), and discussion threads on Reddit. By examining recurring and prevalent job categories, we created a curated list. To rank these jobs, we utilized mean annual wage data from the Bureau of Labor Statistics (BLS). In instances where specific job data was unavailable from BLS, we cross-referenced with Indeed.com and Glassdoor.com for accurate salary information.Here is a list of 25 Best Work-From-Home Jobs for 202325. Content writerMean Annual Wage: $62,606Content writing is a popular remote job due to its flexibility and accessibility. Two prominent companies that facilitate remote content writing opportunities include Upwork Inc (NASDAQ:UPWK) and Fiverr International Ltd (NYSE:FVRR), which are both websites for a freelance marketplace that connect writers with clients.While there are various jobs that will disappear in the future due to AI, human-written content is here to stay because AI-generated content, from bleeding-edge LLMs like GPT has been shown to be unreliable. The phenomon is often dubbed as Artificial Hallucination.24. Voice-Over ArtistMean Annual Wage: $67,099While generally considered an easy work-from-home job due to no formal requirements of prior experience and degree, voice-over-artists are some of the highest paying remote jobs, where experienced professionals may charge as high as $135/hr or more on platforms like Upwork and Fiverr.23. Technical Customer Success ManagerMean Annual Wage: $71,167Technical Customer Success Manager is an attractive remote job as it combines customer service, technical knowledge, and relationship management. Companies like Salesforce, Inc. (NYSE:CRM) and HubSpot, Inc. (NYSE:HUBS) offer remote positions for Technical Customer Success Managers at competitive salaries and opportunities to work with cutting-edge technologies and diverse client portfolios.22. Data analystMean Annual Wage: $77,207Data analysts have the advantage of being in high demand in various industries, making it a highly sought-after remote job. Companies such as Meta Platforms, Inc. (NASDAQ:META) and Amazon.com, Inc. (NASDAQ:AMZN) are known to offer some of the highest salaries to data analysts at remote positions while giving them opportunities for professional growth, and the chance to work with large and diverse datasets from anywhere in the world.21. Art DirectorMean Annual Wage: $78,831Remote art director roles offer creative professionals the freedom to work from anywhere that allows them to collaborate with teams virtually. Companies like Adobe Inc. (NASDAQ:ADBE) and Shutterstock, Inc (NYSE:SSTK) offer positions for remote art directors, with competitive salaries that further facilitate creative projects, and the chance to shape visual aesthetics for global brands. It is one of the most flexible remote jobs.20. Business Development ManagerMean Annual Wage: $80,870A business development manager is responsible for identifying and pursuing growth opportunities for a company. Their main duties include researching potential markets, analyzing customer needs, building relationships with clients, negotiating deals, and implementing strategies to expand business.19. Virtual AssistantMean Annual Wage: $82,338A virtual assistant provides administrative, technical, or creative support to individuals or businesses remotely. It is one of the high-paying remote jobs without a degree or experience.18. Loan OfficerMean Annual Wage: $84,160A loan officer is the professional responsible for evaluating loan applications, assessing the creditworthiness of borrowers, and making recommendations for loan approvals or rejections. They gather financial information, analyze credit histories, verify documentation, and guide borrowers through the loan application process.17. Senior Account ManagerMean Annual Wage: $88,987A senior account manager is a professional responsible for managing relationships with key clients or accounts within a company. They act as the primary point of contact, ensuring client satisfaction, identifying opportunities for growth, and collaborating with internal teams to deliver products or services. There are a number of positions urgently hiring for remote senior account managers currently.16. Database AdministratorMean Annual Wage: $93,464The tasks of a database administrator involve designing and implementing database structures, while looking after data security and integrity. They also optimize database performance, troubleshoot issues, and perform backups and recovery. DBAs may handle user access control and database migrations as well. It is one of the best work-from-home jobs for 2023.15. PsychologistMean Annual Wage: $99,560What makes this a good work-from-home job is the availability of teletherapy platforms, allowing remote counseling sessions. It offers flexibility, convenience, and the opportunity to reach clients beyond geographical limitations. It is also one of the most respected professions in the world.14. Project ManagerMean Annual Wage: $101,610Project managers oversee the planning, execution, and completion of projects. They coordinate resources, manage timelines and budgets, and ensure project goals are achieved efficiently and effectively. Companies such as Cisco Systems, Inc. (NASDAQ:CSCO) and Alphabet Inc. (NASDAQ:GOOG) are known to pay some of highest salaries to their project managers.13. UX DesignerMean Annual Wage: $101,740UX designers create user-centered designs for digital products, focusing on enhancing user experience. They conduct research, create wireframes, prototypes, and collaborate with developers to ensure intuitive and visually appealing user interfaces. It is one of the most popular work-from-home jobs without a degree.12. Clinical Trial ManagerMean Annual Wage: $102,913Clinical trial managers is one of the best work-from-home jobs for 2023. They oversee the planning, execution, and monitoring of clinical trials. They ensure compliance with protocols, while managing study timelines and coordination with stakeholders.11. Product ManagerMean Annual Wage: $112,492Product managers are responsible for guiding the development and success of a product throughout its lifecycle. They define product strategy, conduct market research, prioritize features, coordinate with cross-functional teams, and ensure the product meets customer needs and business objectives. It is considered to be one of the most boring jobs that pay $100,000 or more.10. Data scientistMean Annual Wage: $115,240Popular as the sexiest job of the 21st century, the position of a data scientist is often accompanied by a fairly lucrative salary package. Data scientists analyze and interpret complex data to extract meaningful insights and make data-driven decisions. They apply statistical and machine learning techniques, develop predictive models, and communicate findings to stakeholders. In this respect, the job of a data scientist is far more advanced than the job of data analyst, two related fields that are often confused with each other.Owing to the highly technical nature of their work, these professional command salaries which are almost always justified. Amazon.com Inc (NASDAQ:AMZN) is popular for not only hiring data scientists with profitable salaries but also hiring them for remote positions, allowing them to work from anywhere in the world.9. DevOps EngineerMean Annual Wage: $119,350DevOps engineers bridge the gap between development and operations teams. They automate processes and ensure smooth software delivery. This enables a faster deployment with continuous integration and efficient collaboration within an organization. It is one of the highest paying jobs in the world.8. Cloud EngineerMean Annual Wage: $120,512Cloud engineers design, implement, and manage cloud infrastructure and services. They configure and maintain cloud environments while monitoring performance. They also optimize resource utilization and ensure data security.7. ActuaryMean Annual Wage: $127,580The jobs of actuaries are in high demand and low supply because of their unique skill set and expertise. Their ability to assess complex risks and provide valuable insights makes them sought after, leading to competitive salaries in the market.6. Computer Network ArchitectMean Annual Wage: $129,490Computer network architects design and build communication networks, including LANs, WANs, and intranets. They analyze business requirements, select appropriate hardware and software, and ensure network reliability and scalability.Click here to see 5 Best Work-from-Home Jobs for 2023.Suggested Articles:30 High-Paying Remote Jobs Without a Degree or Experience25 Highest Paying Jobs in the World17 Highest Paying Government Jobs Without a DegreeDisclosure: None. 25 Best Work-From-Home Jobs for 2023 is originally published on Insider Monkey.]

Title: 12 Best Major Stocks to Buy Now
Text: [In this piece, we will take a look at the 12 best major stocks to buy now. If you want to skip our analysis of the market that sees how major and mega cap stocks have dominated this year, head on over to 5 Best Major Stocks to Buy Now. 2023 has been the year of major stocks. Mega cap stocks such as Alphabet Inc. (NASDAQ:GOOG), Meta Platforms, Inc. (NASDAQ:META), and Apple Inc. (NASDAQ:AAPL) have led the stock market in returns and as a result, have pushed the broader market into positive territory. To understand how, consider the fact that year to date, the three firm's shares have appreciated by 34.40%, 129%, and 53.9%, respectively. Commonly called AI, artificial intelligence is simply advanced mathematics that is used to generate new outcomes or predictions based on patterns observed in previously known data sets. The biggest winner by far due to AI is none other than the semiconductor firm NVIDIA Corporation (NASDAQ:NVDA). NVIDIA designs and sells graphics processing units (GPUs) which are used to power up AI systems such as the popular ChatGPT platform. As its reward, investors have piled into NVIDIA's shares, with the stock up a whopping 196% year to date, having added nearly $281 to its current share price of $424. Tesla's shares are up by ~159% year to date, making it rank second only to NVIDIA when it comes to share price outperformance by major companies and stocks.Story continuesBut what about the future? After all, one of the most common mantras on the market is that 'past performance is not indicative of future returns.' Well, on this front, one strategy to study stock market movement is called trend analysis. This involves graphing out previous share price movements and using these to compute probabilities to guess what might take place in the future. These trends analyze investor sentiment on a mass scale and can help analyze whether market sentiment in a stock will sustain. If you're interested in learning more details about this, take a look at 10 Momentum Stocks Billionaires Are Loading Up On.On this front, one of the pros in technical investment, Katie Stockton had some crucial insights to share in an interview with CNBC where she pointed out when her firm was able to guess that the S&P500 index would soar to the heights that is today - fueled of course by mega cap stocks. She shared:You know, when we got the breakout, that's what changed things, in mid May we had the breakout above the 4,155. We were working under the assumption that that range [4,000] would hold and of course it did not. . .We're always just trying to put odds in our favor. Nobody knows what's gonna, you know, be the next month or the next year even. But we're trying to make sure that we have momentum gauges on our side, relative strength on our side, we want to make sure there's no big overbought/sell signals. So that's our charge. We wanna make sure that we have those things supporting the market. And when we do, we're bullish. When we don't, we shift back to bearish bias.So the breakout did yield an objective of about 4,510. That's also aligned with the resistance level through the Fibonacci retracements. So that would be a natural pace for a pullback to unfold more than what we've already seen. And yet, as long as the momentum is there, and as long as we don't have any big overbought sell signals, which we don't at this time, we want to stay with the bullish bias until it proves us otherwise until we see that loss of momentum. Because I think that this market is probably a very long term trading range. If you look at the monthly gauges, you'll see that they tend to flatten out. You look forward a couple of years. So to me, within that context, they have to have an intermediate term focus on momentum, and when we don't have that intermediate term momentum benefiting the market, we wanna be managing risk of course.With these details in mind, let's take a look at some top major stocks to buy.
